description: This file defines a Fragment class for displaying a restaurant's menu in an Android application. It manages the UI components such as the title, metadata, category filter chips, and a RecyclerView for menu items. It also handles interactions like adding items to the cart, favoriting items, and filtering by categories.

classes.name: MenuFragment
classes.description: A Fragment representing the menu screen, allowing users to view, filter, and interact with menu items.

methods.name: onCreate
methods.description: Initializes the fragment, setting up the adapter with callbacks for item interactions.

methods.name: onCreateView
methods.description: Inflates the fragment's layout from XML.

methods.name: onViewCreated
methods.description: Binds UI components, sets up the category chips, and observes data sources for updates.

methods.name: setupCategoryChips
methods.description: Creates category filter chips dynamically based on available categories.

methods.name: openOptionsAndAdd
methods.description: Opens a bottom sheet dialog for configuring item options before adding to cart.

methods.name: newInstance
methods.description: Factory method to create a new instance of MenuFragment with a specified restaurant ID.
